issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:
1. Create an app with all targets other than BB
2. After the app is created open the tiapp.xml & manually add BB target
3. Click to save

Actual result:
1. The BlackBerry folder in the resources folder does not get created & app build fails

LOGS:
{code}

{code}

Expected result:
1. The BackBerry folder should get created 

Attached are the logs where I created an app with only android as a target, then added iphone & ipad as target manually & then added blackberry.
fields.summary: BlackBerry : Adding BlackBerry as target after project creation does not create BlackBerry folder in resources

comments.body:
Verified the fix & the blackberry folder is successfully created after adding the Blackberry target after the project creation.
Thus closing the issue.

Environment:
Ti Studio : 3.1.0.201304031528
Ti BB SDK : 3.2.0.v20130409093412
Mac OSX : 10.8.2
win 7 
Win 8 
BB simulator : 10.0.10.261
Z10 device running 10.0.10.88
